frameDefinitions: An Entity has ceased to exist.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
A  Counter_actor or Cause  impedes an Agent in an Activity or impedes the unfolding or continuation of a State_of_affairs.
A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given Topic.
In this frame a Part is part of a larger Whole comprised of parts that are ordered.
frameExamples: McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.

However, as this story goes on the Queen of Sodom has a brother who
plans to <t>undermine</t> his sister and take the throne of Sodom.
And that is where the <t>history</t> of art begins.
I sat through the first interminable <t><fex name='Part'>act</fex></t>  of the play  .
listRoleDefinitions: Concrete or abstract entity that does not exist after the event.
A point at which the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.
This is the Place where the <fen>Entity</fen> (saliently) does not exist.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
An event or state_of_Affairs that successfully impedes an <fen>Agent</fen> or a State_of_affairs.
A person who intentionally or not acts in such a way that an <fen>Agent</fen> or State_of_affairs is impeded.
A person who is intentionally engaged in some <fen>Activity</fen> and who is impeded in that <fen>Activity</fen>.
An <fen>Activity</fen> that is being impeded.
A state or event that is ongoing and whose continuance or unfolding is impeded.
The time at which the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> works agains the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> subverts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject about which the history is given.
When the events concerning the <fen>Topic</fen> occured.
This is the number of the sequence of <fen>Part</fen>s.
A part of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.
listRoleExamples: He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
Tory rebels queued to warn that <fex>they</fex> wouldsabotage efforts to put the treaty through Parliament .
If he is really undermining <fex>me</fex>, then he is a fine friend.
The Dominican Republic was widely held to have undermined <fex>its own efforts to become a full member of CARICOM</fex>
Whenever I try to quit they all try to sabotage <fex>my efforts</fex>.
The role of the Byzantine Empire in <fex>European</fex> history is not understood by all.
I sat through the <fex>first</fex> interminable <fex>act</fex> of the play .
I sat through the first interminable <fex>act</fex> of the play .
I sat through the first interminable <fex>act</fex> <fex>of the play</fex> .
